channel.title: Comments on: Intranet site for Reporting Services Reports
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Tahir Khalid
item.dc:creator: Tahir Khalid
item.content:encoded:
I did a similar thing a while back with .NET 2.0/C# where a business unit wanted a custom report.

In the end I went for a fully styled ASP.NET page querying the SQL database to and pumping out the results through a graphing component but I wish I had read this article back then.

Good work!

item.title: By: pmch22
item.dc:creator: pmch22
item.content:encoded:
Use the SetParameters method of serverreport to handle parameters. SetParameter method returns an array of report parameter. Get the count of report parameters and assign values in the array.

ReportViewer1.ServerReport.SetParameters(FetchParams(serverReport));

private ReportParameter[] FetchParams(ServerReport rpt)
{

//Create the report parameter
ReportParameter[] reportParam = new ReportParameter[rpt.GetParameters().Count];

//Singlevalue parameter
reportParam[0] = new ReportParameter(“name”, txtbox.Text);

// Add other report params here
reportParam[1] = new ReportParameter(“customerno”, txtbox1.Text);
reportParam[2] = new ReportParameter(“location”, txtbox2.Text);
reportParam[3] = new ReportParameter(“emailaddress”, txtbox3.Text);

return reportParam;

}

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Service library has the ParameterValue class for the parameters when calling up the report viewer

BOL: ms-help://MS.SQLCC.v10/MS.SQLSVR.v10.en/s10rs_8webmrf/html/78beccca-e511-46c0-88f0-0df1a3bfc9b0.htm

And to add the entire library
BOL: ms-help://MS.SQLCC.v10/MS.SQLSVR.v10.en/s10rs_8webmrf/html/caee0f7f-8ecd-4858-b1e8-eb0390337606.htm

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been looking to do basically the same thing (though I need to also handle collecting parameters from the user in the webpage and not on the report itself). This should help me get started.

Thanks!

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
This is an excellent option over the ReportServer rendering options built in. Really opens the doors to endless development paths for SSRS and delivery.

Nice post!
